definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
brimming with enthusiasm (idiom); full of warmth

sentences.english: She gives me a big smile every time she sees me.
sentences.chinese: 她每次看見我都衝我熱情地笑笑。

sentences.english: I want to but Ihave no idea that nothing can cover my enthusiasm .
sentences.chinese: 我想但是沒有東西可以掩蓋我的熱情。

sentences.english: Zeal without knowledge is a runaway.
sentences.chinese: 沒有知識的熱情猶如脫繮野馬。

sentences.english: A girl in Yao minority dress warmly greeting customers.
sentences.chinese: 穿着民族服裝的瑤家姑娘，熱情地招呼來往市民。

sentences.english: Our Chinese teachers are warm-hearted. We've learned a lot here.
sentences.chinese: 我們的中國老師很熱情，在這裏，我們學到很多知識。

sentences.english: Be passionate about your work although toady is Monday.
sentences.chinese: 雖然今天是星期一，但是保持你的工作熱情。

sentences.english: Figueres thanked the crowd for their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 費格雷斯對羣衆的熱情表示感激。

sentences.english: Everywhere we went, the French were grand to us.
sentences.chinese: 我們到處受到法國人的熱情接待。

sentences.english: Hope, whose spur fanned your ardor into flame.
sentences.chinese: 希望，曾用馬刺煽旺你的熱情。

sentences.english: Courage is going from failure to failure with-out losing enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 勇氣就是不斷失敗，而熱情仍在。

sentences.english: Your constant criticism has deadened their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 你接二連三地批評降低了他們的熱情。

sentences.english: Food retailers have cashed in on this opportunity with zeal.
sentences.chinese: 食品零售商懷着熱情利用了這一商機。

sentences.english: Afa sister-in-law very warmly received iron peak a line of people.
sentences.chinese: 阿發嫂非常熱情地接待了鐵峯一行人。

sentences.english: I am a decent and open-minded girl, so I am enthusiastic about studying and work and the life itself.
sentences.chinese: 在平時生活中，我是個開朗熱情大方的孩子。

sentences.english: On such a hot summer, another good news arrived at Somso.
sentences.chinese: 熱情似火的夏天，西堡酒莊又傳來喜訊。

sentences.english: During the first year of my teaching career, I always work with full passion and attention.
sentences.chinese: 在年我的教學生涯中，我總是工作，的熱情和關注。

definition: to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
